content.name: Duolingo
content.description: This one needs no introduction (Duo even made its way in the new Barbie movie!). A good starting point to pick up a new language, and offers the most resources for Spanish and French.

content.name: Busuu
content.description: While Busuu is not entirely free, it has a wide range of lessons categorized from CERF A1 to B2, and by topic like in traditional textbooks. My favorite feature is being able to have my writing corrected by the community.

content.name: Clozemaster
content.description: Clozemaster helps you build vocabulary by exercises like fill in the blanks.

content.name: Language Reactor
content.description: With Language Reactor, you can turn on dual subtitles on YouTube and Netflix! It also created catalogue to help you find videos by language, and many more features!

content.name: Toucan by Babbel
content.description: "Learn a new language just by browsing the internet." - It turns some words on a page into your targeted language and I think it's great.
